H0.text: Evidence of sea floor spreading is the basis of the Theory of Plate Tectonics.

H1.text: Topographic mapping of mountain ranges is the basis for the Theory of Plate Tectonics.

H2.text: An analysis of soil at the plate boundaries is the basis of the Theory of Plate Tectonics.

H3.text: Volcanic activity along coastlines is the basis of the Theory of Plate Tectonics.

A4.text: Plate tectonics came to be accepted by geoscientists after seafloor spreading was validated in the mid- to late 1960s.
